p: Figure 8 : Properties of degradable nanofibers from reactive electrospinning. (A) Scanning electron microscopy images of nanofibers in the dry state (left), half dipped in water (middle, thin film), and fully soaked in water overnight (right, thick scaffold); (B) Swelling of nanofibrous hydrogel (red) relative to a bulk hydrogel (blue) of the same composition, with error bars representing the standard deviation of n=4 replicates; (C) Scanning electron microscopy and (inset) visual images tracking the acid-catalyzed degradation of nanofibers in 1M HCl; (D) Tensile cycling of dry (80 cycles, 20% elongation/cycle) and swollen (325 cycles, 10% elongation/cycle in 10 mM PBS) electrospun nanofibrous hydrogels. Figure modified from reference 33 and reproduced with permission from the Royal Society of Chemistry. Please click here to view a larger version of this figure.
